values.description:
This PR contains two fixes:

1. multiple texcoord set fixes ported from [gazebo pull request #2899](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2899/fix-loading-collada-mesh-that-contains/diff)
2. add line break deliminators when using our own `split` function to parse the dae file. Gazebo did not have this problem as it's using `boost::split` which already takes care of line breaks.
values.title: ColladaLoader fixes

summary.raw:
This PR contains two fixes:

1. multiple texcoord set fixes ported from [gazebo pull request #2899](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2899/fix-loading-collada-mesh-that-contains/diff)
2. add line break deliminators when using our own `split` function to parse the dae file. Gazebo did not have this problem as it's using `boost::split` which already takes care of line breaks.
summary.html:
This PR contains two fixes:

  1. multiple texcoord set fixes ported from gazebo pull request #2899
  2. add line break deliminators when using our own split function to parse the dae file. Gazebo did not have this problem as it's using boost::split which already takes care of line breaks.

values.description:
If I understood correctly, \`std::unary\_function\` [ is redundant not needed in C\+\+11](https://stackoverflow.com/a/22387805) and has been deprecated.

Broken: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign\_gz11/job/ignition\_common-ci-gz11-windows7-amd64/1/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign_gz11/job/ignition_common-ci-gz11-windows7-amd64/1/console)

Fix: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign\_gz11/job/ignition\_common-ci-pr\_any-windows7-amd64/478/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign_gz11/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/478/)
values.title: Do not use std::unary_function, deprecated in c++11 and removed in c++17

summary.raw:
If I understood correctly, \`std::unary\_function\` [ is redundant not needed in C\+\+11](https://stackoverflow.com/a/22387805) and has been deprecated.

Broken: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign\_gz11/job/ignition\_common-ci-gz11-windows7-amd64/1/console](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign_gz11/job/ignition_common-ci-gz11-windows7-amd64/1/console)

Fix: [https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign\_gz11/job/ignition\_common-ci-pr\_any-windows7-amd64/478/](https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign_gz11/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/478/)
summary.html:
If I understood correctly, `std::unary_function` is redundant not needed in C++11 and has been deprecated.

Broken: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign_gz11/job/ignition_common-ci-gz11-windows7-amd64/1/console

Fix: https://build.osrfoundation.org/view/ign_gz11/job/ignition_common-ci-pr_any-windows7-amd64/478/

values.description:
ign-math is already using c++14:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-math/src/0cac2ad588f7db914f353a9a88a939977cd7181c/CMakeLists.txt?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CMakeLists.txt-17

but this has been using c++11 apparently, which causes a compiler warning:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_common-ci-default-bionic-amd64&build=9)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-default-bionic-amd64/9/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-default-bionic-amd64/9/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_common-ci-default-homebrew-amd64&build=115)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/115/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-default-homebrew-amd64/115/
* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_common-ci-default-xenial-amd64&build=82)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-default-xenial-amd64/82/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-default-xenial-amd64/82/

this should fix several of these builds

values.title: Link to main contributing guide

values.description:
The individual explicit templates can be replaced with a single variadic template, which is more readable/maintainable.

Also, there is the addition of `CallbackT` type alias to make some things more convenient in a downstream `EventsManager` object.
values.title: Replace explicit templates with variadic templates and perfect forwarding

summary.raw:
The individual explicit templates can be replaced with a single variadic template, which is more readable/maintainable.

Also, there is the addition of `CallbackT` type alias to make some things more convenient in a downstream `EventsManager` object.
summary.html:
The individual explicit templates can be replaced with a single variadic template, which is more readable/maintainable.

Also, there is the addition of CallbackT type alias to make some things more convenient in a downstream EventsManager object.

values.description:
The `ColladaLoader_TEST` test failure actually helped uncover a bug in the loader. This PR fixes the bug and updates the test to verify all values are loaded correctly. Test failure on Windows should be fixed as the result of these changes.

The additional checks in `Util_TEST` were added while debugging. It’s nice to have so I left them there.
values.title: Fix ColladaLoader test failure on Windows

summary.raw:
The `ColladaLoader_TEST` test failure actually helped uncover a bug in the loader. This PR fixes the bug and updates the test to verify all values are loaded correctly. Test failure on Windows should be fixed as the result of these changes.

The additional checks in `Util_TEST` were added while debugging. It’s nice to have so I left them there.
summary.html:
The ColladaLoader_TEST test failure actually helped uncover a bug in the loader. This PR fixes the bug and updates the test to verify all values are loaded correctly. Test failure on Windows should be fixed as the result of these changes.

The additional checks in Util_TEST were added while debugging. It’s nice to have so I left them there.

values.description:
Duplicating change from the following gazebo pull request:

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3037/switch-timecc-from-clock_realtime-to/diff

Note that the clock resolution is never set in this version of Time.cc, so there is only one line to change.

This targets ign-common1 and will be merged forward.

Note that the clock resolution is never set in this version of Time.cc, so there is only one line to change.

This targets ign-common1 and will be merged forward.
summary.html:
Duplicating change from the following gazebo pull request:

  • https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/3037/switch-timecc-from-clock_realtime-to/diff

Note that the clock resolution is never set in this version of Time.cc, so there is only one line to change.

This targets ign-common1 and will be merged forward.

values.description: The version of tiny obj loader currently used in ignition common doesn’t support triangulating meshes with concave polygons. This PR brings the latest version of tiny obj loader, which adds support for that case.

values.description:
As part of refactoring [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2977/add-gz\_profile-and-introspectionmanager/diff](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2977/add-gz_profile-and-introspectionmanager/diff), I have decided to bring the Profiler into the ignition-common library.

This is still a work in progress, but it shows the implementation of using Remotery \([https://github.com/Celtoys/Remotery](https://github.com/Celtoys/Remotery)\) to profile multiple threads and visualize.

Remotery itself does not provide any CMake logic, so I have done so here: [https://github.com/mjcarroll/remotery\_vendor](https://github.com/mjcarroll/remotery_vendor)

Multiple profiler implementations can be created by inheriting from the ProfilerImpl obj.

You can use the Remotery profiler by:

    # In one terminal
    ./build/ignition-common3/bin/UNIT_Profiler_TEST
    # In another terminal (assuming remotery_vendor)
    xdg-open ./install/share/Remotery/vis/index.html
values.title: Create a common Profiler

summary.raw:
As part of refactoring [https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2977/add-gz\_profile-and-introspectionmanager/diff](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2977/add-gz_profile-and-introspectionmanager/diff), I have decided to bring the Profiler into the ignition-common library.

This is still a work in progress, but it shows the implementation of using Remotery \([https://github.com/Celtoys/Remotery](https://github.com/Celtoys/Remotery)\) to profile multiple threads and visualize.

Remotery itself does not provide any CMake logic, so I have done so here: [https://github.com/mjcarroll/remotery\_vendor](https://github.com/mjcarroll/remotery_vendor)

Multiple profiler implementations can be created by inheriting from the ProfilerImpl obj.

You can use the Remotery profiler by:

    # In one terminal
    ./build/ignition-common3/bin/UNIT_Profiler_TEST
    # In another terminal (assuming remotery_vendor)
    xdg-open ./install/share/Remotery/vis/index.html
summary.html:
As part of refactoring https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2977/add-gz_profile-and-introspectionmanager/diff, I have decided to bring the Profiler into the ignition-common library.

This is still a work in progress, but it shows the implementation of using Remotery (https://github.com/Celtoys/Remotery) to profile multiple threads and visualize.

Remotery itself does not provide any CMake logic, so I have done so here: https://github.com/mjcarroll/remotery_vendor

Multiple profiler implementations can be created by inheriting from the ProfilerImpl obj.

You can use the Remotery profiler by:

# In one terminal
./build/ignition-common3/bin/UNIT_Profiler_TEST
# In another terminal (assuming remotery_vendor)
xdg-open ./install/share/Remotery/vis/index.html

values.description: I found that having multiple events with the same signature can cause issues in the `ign-gazebo` `EventManager`.  This adds an optional second template parameter to disambiguate the events.
values.title: Use a second template argument to disambiguate events with matching signatures.

summary.raw: I found that having multiple events with the same signature can cause issues in the `ign-gazebo` `EventManager`.  This adds an optional second template parameter to disambiguate the events.
summary.html: I found that having multiple events with the same signature can cause issues in the ign-gazebo EventManager. This adds an optional second template parameter to disambiguate the events.

values.description:
I ran into a shortcoming of the `EventT` type in using it with `EventManager`

`typeid()` can’t distinguish between multiple aliases of the same type, so:

    using PeerAdded = EventT<void(PeerInfo)>
    using PeerRemoved = EventT<void(PeerInfo)>

Appear as the same Event type to the manager.

To disambiguate, I added a second optional struct, so the following will be necessary when defining events:

    using PeerAdded = EventT<void(PeerInfo), struct _PeerAdded>
    using PeerRemoved = EventT<void(PeerInfo), struct _PeerRemoved>
values.title: Use a second template argument to disambiguate events with matching signatures.

summary.raw:
I ran into a shortcoming of the `EventT` type in using it with `EventManager`

`typeid()` can’t distinguish between multiple aliases of the same type, so:

    using PeerAdded = EventT<void(PeerInfo)>
    using PeerRemoved = EventT<void(PeerInfo)>

Appear as the same Event type to the manager.

To disambiguate, I added a second optional struct, so the following will be necessary when defining events:

    using PeerAdded = EventT<void(PeerInfo), struct _PeerAdded>
    using PeerRemoved = EventT<void(PeerInfo), struct _PeerRemoved>
summary.html:
I ran into a shortcoming of the EventT type in using it with EventManager

typeid() can’t distinguish between multiple aliases of the same type, so:

using PeerAdded = EventT<void(PeerInfo)>
using PeerRemoved = EventT<void(PeerInfo)>

Appear as the same Event type to the manager.

To disambiguate, I added a second optional struct, so the following will be necessary when defining events:

using PeerAdded = EventT<void(PeerInfo), struct _PeerAdded>
using PeerRemoved = EventT<void(PeerInfo), struct _PeerRemoved>

values.description:
By default, macOS and Windows use a case-preserving but case-insensitive filesystem, which means you can change the capitalization of letters in filenames, like `Profiler.hh`, but you can't have both `Profiler.hh` and `profiler.hh` in the same folder. This caused the homebrew bottle build to fail:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_highsierra&build=112)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_highsierra/112/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_highsierra/112/

Since there's only one header for the profiler, I think we don't need the auto-generated header. This approach is also taken by the `loader` component of ign-plugin:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugin/src/5c011c9b6a64509320e8bb56d510a8b1c5df66db/loader/CMakeLists.txt?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CMakeLists.txt-34:36
values.title: profiler: don't autogenerate a profiler.hh header since it breaks macOS and windows

summary.raw:
By default, macOS and Windows use a case-preserving but case-insensitive filesystem, which means you can change the capitalization of letters in filenames, like `Profiler.hh`, but you can't have both `Profiler.hh` and `profiler.hh` in the same folder. This caused the homebrew bottle build to fail:

* [![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_highsierra&build=112)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_highsierra/112/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_highsierra/112/

Since there's only one header for the profiler, I think we don't need the auto-generated header. This approach is also taken by the `loader` component of ign-plugin:

* #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugin/src/5c011c9b6a64509320e8bb56d510a8b1c5df66db/loader/CMakeLists.txt?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CMakeLists.txt-34:36
summary.html:
By default, macOS and Windows use a case-preserving but case-insensitive filesystem, which means you can change the capitalization of letters in filenames, like Profiler.hh, but you can't have both Profiler.hh and profiler.hh in the same folder. This caused the homebrew bottle build to fail:

  • https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/generic-release-homebrew_bottle_builder/label=osx_highsierra/112/

Since there's only one header for the profiler, I think we don't need the auto-generated header. This approach is also taken by the loader component of ign-plugin:

  • #!/ignitionrobotics/ign-plugin/src/5c011c9b6a64509320e8bb56d510a8b1c5df66db/loader/CMakeLists.txt?at=default&fileviewer=file-view-default#CMakeLists.txt-34:36

* Bump the C\+\+ standard used in ignition common 3.x to c\+\+17.

summary.raw:
* Updated hash algorithm to make sure that we can use `constexpr` to generate the hash at compile time if possible.
* Bump the C\+\+ standard used in ignition common 3.x to c\+\+17.
summary.html:
• Updated hash algorithm to make sure that we can use constexpr to generate the hash at compile time if possible.
  • Bump the C++ standard used in ignition common 3.x to c++17.

values.description:
ign-common and gazebo use similar color console mechanisms, but the log files can be very large. A [gazebo pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2253/reduce-jenkins-console-log-size-fix/diff#chg-gazebo/common/Console.cc) helped reduce it a bit, so let's port it to ign-common as well.

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/commits/10c16cfc0035144e4b523716615fe8fe5162

Here's the raw console output from `UNIT_SubMesh_TEST` on ign-common3:

* https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-ci-ign-common3-bionic-amd64/5/consoleText

~~~
78: [ RUN      ] SubMeshTest.SubMesh
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m300[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m195[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m176[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m
78: [1;31m[Err] [0m[1;31m[[0m[1;31mSubMesh.cc[0m[1;31m:[0m[1;31m238[0m[1;31m] [0m[1;31mIndex too large[0m[1;31m[0m

values.title: port gazebo console log size reduction to ignition (issue #47)

summary.raw:
ign-common and gazebo use similar color console mechanisms, but the log files can be very large. A [gazebo pull request](https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/pull-requests/2253/reduce-jenkins-console-log-size-fix/diff#chg-gazebo/common/Console.cc) helped reduce it a bit, so let's port it to ign-common as well.

* https://bitbucket.org/osrf/gazebo/commits/10c16cfc0035144e4b523716615fe8fe5162

values.description:
Added a few functions to `common::Battery` to support porting of LinearBatteryPlugin and LinearBatteryConsumerPlugin from Gazebo classic. Specifically, the copy constructor \(for battery component definition in `ign-gazebo/include/ignition/gazebo/components/Battery.hh`\) and equal to operator \(for component creation in `SdfEntityCreator.cc`\).

Tested in [the port](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/234/acropolis-port-battery-plugin-from-gazebo/diff).
values.title: Battery additions for plugin port

summary.raw:
Added a few functions to `common::Battery` to support porting of LinearBatteryPlugin and LinearBatteryConsumerPlugin from Gazebo classic. Specifically, the copy constructor \(for battery component definition in `ign-gazebo/include/ignition/gazebo/components/Battery.hh`\) and equal to operator \(for component creation in `SdfEntityCreator.cc`\).

Tested in [the port](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-gazebo/pull-requests/234/acropolis-port-battery-plugin-from-gazebo/diff).
summary.html:
Added a few functions to common::Battery to support porting of LinearBatteryPlugin and LinearBatteryConsumerPlugin from Gazebo classic. Specifically, the copy constructor (for battery component definition in ign-gazebo/include/ignition/gazebo/components/Battery.hh) and equal to operator (for component creation in SdfEntityCreator.cc).

Tested in the port.

values.description:
There is a problem with some homebrew bottles that refer to paths inside Xcode (see [osrf/homebrew-simulation#676](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/issues/676)) that essentially makes Xcode a transitive dependency when building downstream projects, when the command-line development tools should be sufficient. Currently the ignition-common3 bottle on mojave refers to Xcode in this way, which causes builds to fail on one of our new mac minis that doesn't have a full Xcode install.

I'm planning to add tests to the homebrew formulae to ensure that these references to Xcode don't leak in again. This is a fix, that gives cmake a hint for a more portable place to look for frameworks on osx.
values.title: Profiler: give hint on osx to find frameworks so it doesn't find them inside Xcode

summary.raw:
There is a problem with some homebrew bottles that refer to paths inside Xcode (see [osrf/homebrew-simulation#676](https://github.com/osrf/homebrew-simulation/issues/676)) that essentially makes Xcode a transitive dependency when building downstream projects, when the command-line development tools should be sufficient. Currently the ignition-common3 bottle on mojave refers to Xcode in this way, which causes builds to fail on one of our new mac minis that doesn't have a full Xcode install.

I'm planning to add tests to the homebrew formulae to ensure that these references to Xcode don't leak in again. This is a fix, that gives cmake a hint for a more portable place to look for frameworks on osx.
summary.html:
There is a problem with some homebrew bottles that refer to paths inside Xcode (see osrf/homebrew-simulation#676) that essentially makes Xcode a transitive dependency when building downstream projects, when the command-line development tools should be sufficient. Currently the ignition-common3 bottle on mojave refers to Xcode in this way, which causes builds to fail on one of our new mac minis that doesn't have a full Xcode install.

I'm planning to add tests to the homebrew formulae to ensure that these references to Xcode don't leak in again. This is a fix, that gives cmake a hint for a more portable place to look for frameworks on osx.

values.title: Update tolower

values.description: See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bayer_filter
values.title: Fix bayer pixel format typo

summary.raw: See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bayer_filter
summary.html: See: https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Bayer_filter

values.description:
The `BAYER_RGGR8` pixel format is wrong; the Bayer filter uses 50% green pixels, 25% blue, and 25% red, so each of these 4-character strings should have 2 G's, 1 B, and 1 G, but `RGGR` is missing a B. There is already `RGGB`, so `BGGR` should replace `RGGR`, as pull request #191 proposes, though it breaks API/ABI, so it would have to target default. This is an alternative that could go into `ign-common3` since it adds enum values instead of replacing them.

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_common-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=72)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/72/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/72/API_5fABI_20report/
values.title: Image.hh: append BAYER_BGGR8 instead of replacing BAYER_RGGR8

summary.raw:
The `BAYER_RGGR8` pixel format is wrong; the Bayer filter uses 50% green pixels, 25% blue, and 25% red, so each of these 4-character strings should have 2 G's, 1 B, and 1 G, but `RGGR` is missing a B. There is already `RGGB`, so `BGGR` should replace `RGGR`, as pull request #191 proposes, though it breaks API/ABI, so it would have to target default. This is an alternative that could go into `ign-common3` since it adds enum values instead of replacing them.

[![Build Status](https://build.osrfoundation.org/buildStatus/icon?job=ignition_common-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64&build=72)](https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/72/) https://build.osrfoundation.org/job/ignition_common-abichecker-any_to_any-ubuntu_auto-amd64/72/API_5fABI_20report/
summary.html:
The BAYER_RGGR8 pixel format is wrong; the Bayer filter uses 50% green pixels, 25% blue, and 25% red, so each of these 4-character strings should have 2 G's, 1 B, and 1 G, but RGGR is missing a B. There is already RGGB, so BGGR should replace RGGR, as pull request #191 proposes, though it breaks API/ABI, so it would have to target default. This is an alternative that could go into ign-common3 since it adds enum values instead of replacing them.

values.description:
This PR, together with the [PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/184), add Actor support in skeleton. Basically, it add following function to support Actor animation:

* `AddBvhAnimation`: load bvh animation for the skeleton
* `AlignTranslation`: translation alignment \(node local transformations\) from the animation skeleton to mesh skeleton
* `AlignRotation`: rotation alignment \(node local transformations\) from the animation skeleton to mesh skeleton
* `NodeNameAnimToSkin`: node name mapping from animation skeleton to mesh skeleton

Also, a new class `TrajectoryInfo` is created in `Animation` class for actor trajectory.
values.title: add bvh animation support for skeleton

summary.raw:
This PR, together with the [PR](#!/ignitionrobotics/ign-rendering/pull-requests/184), add Actor support in skeleton. Basically, it add following function to support Actor animation:

* `AddBvhAnimation`: load bvh animation for the skeleton
* `AlignTranslation`: translation alignment \(node local transformations\) from the animation skeleton to mesh skeleton
* `AlignRotation`: rotation alignment \(node local transformations\) from the animation skeleton to mesh skeleton
* `NodeNameAnimToSkin`: node name mapping from animation skeleton to mesh skeleton

Also, a new class `TrajectoryInfo` is created in `Animation` class for actor trajectory.
summary.html:
This PR, together with the PR, add Actor support in skeleton. Basically, it add following function to support Actor animation:

  • AddBvhAnimation: load bvh animation for the skeleton
  • AlignTranslation: translation alignment (node local transformations) from the animation skeleton to mesh skeleton
  • AlignRotation: rotation alignment (node local transformations) from the animation skeleton to mesh skeleton
  • NodeNameAnimToSkin: node name mapping from animation skeleton to mesh skeleton

Also, a new class TrajectoryInfo is created in Animation class for actor trajectory.
